PATIENT_ID: TEST_BLUNT_ABD_001
ARRIVAL_TIME: 2026-01-22 07:00:00

[TRAUMA_HP] 2026-01-22 07:10:00
Category I trauma activation for 25-year-old male, MVC with seatbelt sign.
Blunt abdominal trauma suspected. Seatbelt mark across lower abdomen.
BP 85/55, HR 125, RR 28, GCS 15.
Abdomen: distended, diffusely tender with guarding.
Hemodynamically unstable, hypotension requiring fluid resuscitation.

[NURSING_NOTE] 2026-01-22 07:15:00
FAST exam positive for free fluid in Morison pouch and pelvis.
2L crystalloid administered. BP 95/60, HR 115, RR 24.

[IMAGING] 2026-01-22 07:30:00
CT abdomen with contrast: Grade IV splenic laceration with active extravasation.
Moderate hemoperitoneum. No other solid organ injury.

[PHYSICIAN_NOTE] 2026-01-22 07:35:00
Blunt abdominal injury with hemodynamic instability and positive FAST.
Hemodynamically unstable despite resuscitation. Taken emergently to OR for laparotomy.
